identified-content.classifier: Foot Locker National Interscholastic Outdoor Championships

abstract.p: Dathan Ritzenheim, anchoring four-mile relay team, posts outstanding performance in Foot Locker National Interscholastic Outdoor Championships in Raleigh, NC (S)

block.p: Eleven hours after winning the boys' two-mile run, Dathan Ritzenheim posted another outstanding performance yesterday when he anchored Rockford (Mich.) High School's four-mile relay to victory in the Foot Locker National Interscholastic Outdoor Championships in Raleigh, N.C.
Ritzenheim, a junior, ran the anchor-leg mile in 4 minutes 12.2 seconds. The Rockford team won in 17:21.57.

Eleven hours after winning the boys' two-mile run, Dathan Ritzenheim posted another outstanding performance yesterday when he anchored Rockford (Mich.) High School's four-mile relay to victory in the Foot Locker National Interscholastic Outdoor Championships in Raleigh, N.C.
Ritzenheim, a junior, ran the anchor-leg mile in 4 minutes 12.2 seconds. The Rockford team won in 17:21.57.
Late Friday night in the two-mile run, Ritzenheim won in 8:48.06. Rockford's girls' four-mile relay also won, taking the lead on the opening leg and finishing in 20:30.57.

Rickey Harris's attempt to erase the 18-year-old boys' 400-meter hurdles record of 50.02 seconds failed when he hit the ninth hurdle but he managed a swift 51.14-second victory. Anita Siraki, a Glendale, Calif., junior, won the girls' two-mile run in 10:18.03.
Sheena Johnson of Woodbridge, Va., won the girls' 400-meter hurdles in 57.55 seconds, which qualified her for the Olympic trials.
